io.spine.base

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.base.Environment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logging

    @SPI
public final class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
implements Logging
    Provides information about the environment (current platform used, etc.).

    Detecting the type of the environment

    Current implementation allows to obtain the type of the current environment, or to check whether current environment type matches another type. Two environment types exist out of the box:

    • Tests is detected if the current call stack has a reference to a unit testing framework.
    • Production is set in all other cases.

    The framework users may define their custom settings depending on the current environment type: 

    
 public final class Application {

     private final EmailSender sender;

     private Application() {
         Environment environment = Environment.instance();
         if(environment.is(Tests.class)) {
             // Do not send out emails if in tests.
             this.sender = new MockEmailSender();
         } else {
             this.sender = EmailSender.withConfig("email_gateway.yml");
         }
         //...
     }
 }

    Custom environment types

    Environment allows to reguster custom types. In this case the environment detection functionality iterates over all known types, starting with those registered by the framework user: 
    
 public final class Application {

     static {
         Environment.instance()
                    .register(new Staging())
                    .register(new LoadTesting());
     }

     private final ConnectionPool pool;

     private Application() {
         Environment environment = Environment.instance();
         if (environment.is(Tests.class) {
              // Single connection is enough for tests.
             this.pool = new ConnectionPoolImpl(PoolCapacity.of(1));
         } else {
             if(environment.is(LoadTesting.class) {
                 this.pool =
                         new ConnectionPoolImpl(PoolCapacity.fromConfig("load_tests.yml"));
             } else {
                 this.pool =
                         new ConnectionPoolImpl(PoolCapacity.fromConfig("cloud_deployment.yml"));
             }
         }
         //...
     }
 }

    Caching

    Environment caches the EnvironmentType once its calculated. This means that if one environment type has been found to be active, its instance is saved. If later it becomes logically inactive, e.g. the environment variable that's used to check the environment type changes, Environment is still going to return the cached value. To overwrite the value use setTo(EnvironmentType). Also, the value may be reset(). For example: 

    
     Environment environment = Environment.instance();
     EnvironmentType awsLambda = new AwsLambda();
     environment.register(awsLambda);
     assertThat(environment.is(AwsLambda.class)).isTrue();

     System.clearProperty(AwsLambda.AWS_ENV_VARIABLE);

     // Even though `AwsLambda` is not active, we have cached the value, and `is(AwsLambda.class)`
     // is `true`.
     assertThat(environment.is(AwsLambda.class)).isTrue();

     environment.reset();

     // When `reset` explicitly, cached value is erased.
     assertThat(environment.is(AwsLambda.class)).isFalse();

    When registering custom types, please ensure their mutual exclusivity. If two or more environment types consider themselves enabled at the same time, the behaviour of is(Class) is undefined.

    See Also:
    EnvironmentType, Tests, Production

    • Method Detail

      • register

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public Environment register(EnvironmentType type)
        Remembers the specified environment type, allowing to determine whether it's enabled later.

        Note that the default types are still present. When trying to determine which environment type is enabled, the user-defined types are checked first, in the first-registered to last-registered order.

        Parameters:
        type - a user-defined environment type
        Returns:
        this instance of Environment
        See Also:
        Tests, Production

      • instance

        public static Environment instance()
        Returns the singleton instance.

      • createCopy

        public Environment createCopy()
        Creates a copy of the instance so that it can be later restored via restoreFrom(Environment) by cleanup in tests.

      • is

        public boolean is(java.lang.Class<? extends EnvironmentType> type)
        Determines whether the current environment is the same as the specified one.

        If custom environment types have been registered, the method goes through them in the latest-registered to earliest-registered order. Then, checks Tests and Production.

        Please note that this method follows assigment compatibility: 

        
     abstract class AppEngine extends EnvironmentType {
         ...
     }

     final class AppEngineStandard extends AppEngine {
         ...
     }

     Environment environment = Environment.instance();

     // Assuming we are under App Engine Standard
     assertThat(environment.is(AppEngine.class)).isTrue();
        Returns:
        whether the current environment type matches the specified one

      • type

        public java.lang.Class<? extends EnvironmentType> type()
        Returns the type of the current environment.

      • isTests

        @Deprecated
public boolean isTests()
        Deprecated. use Environment.instance().is(Tests.class)
        Verifies if the code currently runs under a unit testing framework.
        See Also:
        Tests

      • isProduction

        @Deprecated
public boolean isProduction()
        Deprecated. use Environment.instance().is(Production.class)
        Verifies if the code runs in the production mode.

        This method is opposite to isTests().

        Returns:
        true if the code runs in the production mode, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Production

      • restoreFrom

        public void restoreFrom(Environment copy)
        Restores the state from the instance created by createCopy().

        Call this method when cleaning up tests that modify Environment.

      • setTo

        public void setTo(EnvironmentType type)
        Sets the current environment type to type.getClass(). Overrides the current value. If the supplied type was not registered previously, it is registered.

      • setTo

        @Internal
public void setTo(java.lang.Class<? extends EnvironmentType> type)
        Sets the current environment type to the specified one. Overrides the current value. If the supplied type was not registered previously, it is registered.

      • setToTests

        @Deprecated
public void setToTests()
        Deprecated. use setTo(Class)
        Turns the test mode on.

        This method is opposite to setToProduction().

      • setToProduction

        @Deprecated
public void setToProduction()
        Deprecated. use setTo(Class)
        Turns the production mode on.

        This method is opposite to setToTests().

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the instance and clears the TestsProperty.

        Erases all registered environment types, leaving only Tests and Production.
